paper_abstract: A tiling in a finite abelian group H is a pair (T, L) of subsets of H such that any h epsilon H can be uniquely represented as t + I where t epsilon T and I epsilon L. This paper studies a finite analogue of self-affine tilings in Euclidean spaces and applies it to a problem of broadcasting on circuit switched networks. We extend the tiling argument of Peters and Syska [Joseph G. Peters, Michel Syska, Circuit switched broadcasting in torus networks, IEEE Trans. Parallel Distrib. Syst., 7 (1996) 246-255] to 3-dimensional torus networks. (c) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Broadcastings and digit tilings on three-dimensional torus networks
